And since my wife's eyesight is not the best, I was looking for a provision to increase the font size. I hope my experience improves with time and that Android apps become available soon.

Item.ReviewTitle: Just as Good As any Tablet out there.
Item.Review:
Pros: Tablet size is perfect, never feels too big and bulky!
Cons: Waiting for OS update, but patience will pay off in the long run.
As with any tablet the first iteration is not going to be the best, but as with Android Tablets, the updates will come and soon enough people can quit wishing for Netflix and Native Email and Calendar. Battery life is excellent and the screen is very nice and vibrant. Surfing the web is the best out there on a tablet and you will find it hard to crank up the laptop if you do not have to type alot (of course you could always buy and add- on keyboard if you needed to) Best of all is the price that no other (real) tablet can compete. Stop hesitating and purchase and start enjoying the convience of a great peice of hardware.

Pros: The Size, Specs and Quality
Cons: The lack of recognition of this incredible tablet.
I am a huge fan of this Tablet. The multitasking aspect is far superior to any other tablet. Soon the 2.0 OS will come out for it and make it even better. The Size is perfect. I was able to take this tablet with me for a backpacking trip through Scotland. The Videos an pictures I took were amazing. The durability and size make it perfect for everyday everywhere use.

Pros: Size & ease of use
Cons: Very limited available app
I purchased the BlackBerry PlayBook Tablet with 32GB Memory because of the price ($299) and the BlackBerry brand.
It was very easy to use, my 7 & 9 year olds learned its functionality within minutes. I like the size, look and feel.
However, it has a VERY limited selection of apps, no Kindle, no Nook, book reader apps. Few business apps that were useful for me. Overall it was a disappointment because it lacked the needed applications for my work & life. Had those been available I would still have it and be happy.

Pros: flash, sound, and camera quality
Cons: weight... kinda heavy...
i love this playbook... can play most of the vid and can play flash on website too :D
i cant wait for 2.0 OS :D

Pros: Easy set up and fast loads web pages quick.
Cons: Nothing
Well, i was debating for a while before getting the Blackberry playbook. I must say i am very happy with this product and was able to get it at the 199.99 price, what a steal. Its fast and i can do everthing i need to do and then some.I get to all my emails including work,all websites and they load fast. If your thinking about this don't think anymore just go get it. The size is perfect the price was right and the tablet is awesome.

Pros: size function look
Cons: battery life isnt as good as the ipads
i have been enjoying the playbook for a few months now and i love it. i have two ipad 2s and i believe this to be the superior tablet. ipads have better apps, although playbook is working on that, but when it comes to real use and functionality and multi tasking this playbook is terrific. my children 2 and 3 years old received one each for xmas, the apps for them are great. i use it for business and life management. also just browsing the web and socializing. great tablet. Go RIM.

Item.ReviewTitle: Good deal for the 199 sale amount
Item.Review:
Pros: Blackberry Bridge, Files, HD screen and good sound. Good speed.
Cons: Read the comments
The Playbook is a good deal for the 199 sale amount. May consider an Apple if paying full price. Playbook works great and fast enough. Have zero issues with operating, sync, wifi access, etc. Good video and pictures if outside. Overall, I'm happy with my purchase. Pros; Can bridge with BB cell and have internet access anywhere for no cost! Can download files Excel,Word, PP etc. Access to files w/o internet. Downsides; BB has a limited number of apps compatible w/playbook. Files download into general access and you cannot create additional folders for seperating specific files. (Still better than ipod, where you must have internet to access files). Will not accept any type of addition ... al USB file storage. Sometimes hitting the correct email or icon on the touchpad is difficult if you have larger fingers, but I still like the smaller size than iPad. Note-there is an OS update coming in Feb, which is suppossed to fix the majority of wants and needs. expand » « collapse

Pros: Size, OS
Cons: Lack of removable storage
My idea of a tablet is something bigger than a phone, but smaller than a notebook; something highly portable. I prefer the 7" format for these reasons. The Playbook is a solid tablet from a hardware perspective and the QNX OS is very stable ans secure. The biggest shortfall is the lack of a SDHC slot cuz 16MB is not that much when it comes to storing photos and music. I am anxiously awaiting the OS upgrade from Blackberry next month which should give the Playbook the ability to use android apps. There are apps currently available through the BB website but nothing compared to android apps. The Samsung Galaxy Tab 7+ is the only other tablet I considered, but it is nearly twice the price.

Pros: very good price
Cons: Maybe if they offered a choice in different screen sizes.
The Blackberry Playbook is a great compact tablet. It's fast and easy to use. I have had mine for a couple of weeks now and I am very satisfied with it. I would recommend the Playbook to anyone.

Item.ReviewTitle: Still needs a lot of improvement
Item.Review:
Pros: Screen and sound quality
Cons: Not much apps, no manual and sunk on/off switch
The Playbook is average in my opinion. It still needs a lot of support, apps and improvement. I do not not why, RIM did not provide a hard copy manual with the tablet, every time you try to know something about it you will have to go on line. I've it for about three month now and still do not know a lot about its functions I/P ports and more. When I first bought it it was dropping the internet connection alot and I had to call the company for that, it is not doing it as much now. The On/Off switch is too bad and you'll have to have a sharp finger nails to get it to work as it is sunk in the frame. There is no a solid answer if this tablet has a GPS or not. Also, sometimes it freezes and refus ... es to work till it takes its time or you re-boot it. I got this tablet on sale during the thanksgiving time for $199 and I think that this should be the price always and not higher. In summary I think RIM was in a harry to put this toy on the market while it still needs some work. expand » « collapse

Pros: Very Fluid and responsive..
Bought this two weeks ago.Its awesome. The UI is simply superb and so very fluid. The multi tasking works flawlessly. I mostly use the Browser and its simply superb, handles all the flash content with ease. The NFS game is an added attraction. I dont mind less apps available thing, whatz d use of so many apps when u cant run 'em without sayin 'augh!!' as with Android devices..also battery runs good...Final verdict is this absolutely great tablet!!

Item.ReviewTitle: Awesome Except For A Few Things
Item.Review:
Pros: Screen, Camera, Multi Tasking etc.
Cons: Not real good app world, and no Netflix.
I have had this tablet for 2 months. Love it! I get atleast 7 hours of battery life which is amazing compared to my 45 minute ipod touch's battery life! (2nd Gen). The screen is amazing! The touch sensitive sides are handy but sometimes can be a little annoying. The operating system is easy to use and is uberly handy! The app world does pretty much suck. Some good apps but the app world is getting better. Oh, and NO Netflix! I am surprised because iPad does not support flash and this tablet does, yet you can watch Netflix on iPad but not on here! But it should be available soon. Overall, this is a great tablet if you dont mind waiting a while to get alot of apps and Netflix. :) Oh, and the ... speakers are AMAZING! expand » « collapse

Pros: Great business tablet
Cons: Found nothing wrong yet
I already own the 64 GB Playbook and recently purchased my fiancee the 16 GB for Christmas. We both have Blackberry phones for security purposes and the Playbook's Blackberry Bridge allows us to browse the internet without WiFi and tethering (extra cost) when we are in remote locations. It also syncs with our phones and we can update calendars, memos, and contacts as well as read/delete email messages from our phones by using the Playbook. It has Word to Go, an Excel program, and a Powerpoint program pre-installed. Its size lets me carry it anywhere and is even discreet enough to carry into business meetings when it is housed in its leather cover. If you are serious about business applications and security, then this i ... s the best tablet on the market. If you just want a toy to play games on, then get an IPAD2 or Android tablet. Although...the Playbook does have many games (Angry Birds, Dead Space, Monopoly, etc.) if you need a break from work and the graphics and sound are great. expand » « collapse

Pros: size, blackberry operating platform is easy to navigate
the 7 inch screen is perfect, can hold in hands and type easily. the operating layout is better than ipad, to navigate u just slide your finger on different areas of the screen, unlike the ipad where u push home sceen button then select. perfect for online shopping, emails, surfing the web.

Pros: Performance, Screen res, Batt life, easy to use
Cons: Balckberry to Balckberry only Video Chat
I got thisBlackberry 16G Playbook as a Christmas gift from my wife and son. This thing is increadible. The laser beam quick performance out-does our brand new DELL Home PC. The Video chat app states blackberry ID to Blackberry ID... I hope to figure a way around it w/ some online research...or wait for skype to get the new app for the blackberry playbook. It has Blackberry Market apps that I am not too familiar with yet but seem in-line w/ the android market. The screen res was fantastic. The Battery finally died after about 9 or so hours of use... which is increadible to me. Also, it has fantastic sound from its micro speakers. Even w/ video chat to blackberry ID Blackberrys ... only... still give it a 5 star. expand » « collapse

Pros: Setup, Price, Power
Cons: Nothing yet
I bought this tablet for my business. I loved it so much I bought one for my daughter, wife and 75yo mother. My mother loves it. She even takes it to bingo to play games in between sections. I have looked at some others and for size and power. I believe its the best.

Item.ReviewTitle: The best 7" tablet out there - No regrets
Item.Review:
For users with Blackberry phones with data plans, this is the best tablet to buy. Period.
Of course, there will be Apple & rabid iPad fans, but, some of them are totally missing the big picture. Apple doesn't always deliver the best product in the best interest of consumers.
So, who wants to pay extra monthly fees if you're already paying big bucks for your data plan on your iPhone? Pay another data plan for the iPad. Not me.
Thanks to Blackberry PlayBook & the BB Bridge software plus my data plan on my BB Bold. I have the best tablet in the planet today.
The 7" screen is just the right size. The iPad looks like a dinosaur. Movies, eBooks, my mail and the glorious web are rendered so much faster on the PlayBook than the iPad.
It's so unbelievab ... ly fast & sleek that I'm buying a second one for my wife during this "sale" by Blackberry again! expand » « collapse

Pros: The price.
Cons: Non use of sim cards
I purchased the blackberry Wednesday for express delivery and it arrived the very next day, WoW! I couldn't wait to begin playing with it. The tablet is very sleek and well built which is not surprising being made by BlackBerry. It's definately user friendly for someone like myself who is a first time tablet user. I'm still trying to figure out how to use my xfinity and neflix to watch movies, but nevertheless I'm enjoying the use of it. Can't wait until more apps become available even though there's plenty of apps currently available on it. I'm ordering one for my husband today. I will be recommending it to my family and friends. And one more thing, the sound on this table is phenominal!!!!

Item.ReviewTitle: An Amazing Tablet...as long as you know...
Item.Review:
Pros: Elegant, Fast, Unrivaled Browsing Experience
Cons: Lack of apps (for now)
I have never written a review before, but I felt compelled to tell you a story. The story of the best purchase I have ever made. That being said, I will be FAIR and point out from the beginning that the PlayBook is NOT for everybody.
Some things to know about me:
- I own an IPAD 2 - I have never owned anything from Blackberry - I love Android and its extensive market - I like long walks on the beach....oh wait, I digress.... - This review hinges on the price remaining close to $200
If you are like me, you are reading this review because you were being diligent and doing your research to make sure the Playbook is the right fit for you. This won't be the only review ... you read, but let's start off with all the negatives you will undoubtedly come across:
- Lack of Apps: This isn't an IPAD or Android based tablet, so you won't have access to the THOUSANDS AND THOUSANDS of apps on those systems. If you are an app junkie, walk away right now. - Lack of built in Email/Calendar: I don't know how a company called Research in Motion didn't do any research into every other tablet ever made because they would have found that the lack of a native Email program/Calendar is an embarrassing oversight - Power Button is really small - Some people are bothered by its size - Camera does NOT have LED flash
Ok now let's get to the good stuff:
- This thing multitasks better than my PC! LOL, for reals, it's amazing how you can run 5 or 6 different apps without skipping a beat. The OS on the PlayBook is simply superb in that respect. - The screen is OUT OF THIS WORLD! Seriously, I have an Ipad 2 and the clarity, brightness, and colors are AT LEAST on par with it. - While some people have complained about the size (Seriously, people, did you NOT look at the specs before you bought it? How do you even sleep at night after writing a review and complaining about the size when the rest of us are sitting here wondering what you thought you were buying?), I find the size perfect. - It feels so ... expand » « collapse

Pros: Great price, easy to use, works amazing!
Cons: the iPad exists and people think its chocolate on a stick
This tablets hardware and software is about 50 times better than the iPad and more than 50% cheaper! The world is wasting its time focusing on the iPad while great tablets like this fall to the wayside. Please be an educated buyer and you will realize you get more for your money if you buy this instead of the iPad.

Pros: Easy to use, great touch screen, runs very fast
Cons: App World
This is one of the best products I own. This product is is very easy to use and set up. The touch screen works great and it's very responsive. It has a front and rear camera, however the camera does not have a flash but that doesn't really matter to me. This device does have adobe flash so you can go on any site and it will look just like it would on a regular desktop or laptop. You can also watch videos on sites like youtube and megavideo. However hulu and netflix does not support blackberry yet. Also there are not many apps available to this device yet but it is fairly new and new apps are being introduced everyday. I bought it when it was on sale but it is definitely worth the price it is right now. I pr ... efer this over the iPad because of it's flash support. If you want a good tablet that is easy to use with many great and advanced features this is it. expand » « collapse

I m really happy with my Playbook. I bought it during their sale recently. I read quite a few reviews on other sites before I bought it, and the main criticisms are the size and not enough apps. As far as the size, you know what you are buying ahead of time, and the picture is really excellent. I guess it depends on what size you prefer. I m not sure how many apps anyone needs, but it seems to have plenty. No Angry Birds though, which my kids want, and I would like a Skype app. The word on other sites is that an upgrade due out in Feb. 2012 will enable it to get more apps. The camera works great. The picture is excellent. The operating system is seemless. For the sale price, I think it was a great buy. Now if it was full price, I might want something with a large screen, and a usb port or ... micro sd port for storage. expand » « collapse

Item.ReviewTitle: Not at all a good buy
Item.Review:
I am a veteran iPad user and a blackberry user for the past several years. I purchased Blackberry playbook based upon the reviews which I think were posted by RIM. I have had a terrible experience with the Playbook and found it totally useless unless one wants to use it to play video games.
Its on/off button is very hard. Battery shall drain away when its on the standby mode. NO EMAIL. Not many applications.
Conclusion: Not a good buy even for $100.

Can t believe how cool this playbook turned out to be. Blackberry hit a homerun, and the shame is, no one knows. It was priced too high before, but after the big drop, a total steal! I ve had it for two weeks and I can honestly say I love it. Best part is the form factor, perfect to hold in your hands for typing, and the operating system blows iOS and Android right out of the water. The browser is like having a full sized laptop. Highly recommend at the $199 price point. Typed this review from my playbook, sitting on the couch!

Item.ReviewTitle: Great Tablet out of the Box
Item.Review: It s easy to use out of box. Connected to my wireless network easily. Customer support helped me to upload and download files from my desktop using WIFI (fast, knowledgeable and courteous). The USB cable connection works just as well. Online videos and manuals are very helpful getting up to speed. I m completely satisfied after 1 week.
